Sentencas: Chromium- and silicon-poisoned samples of the intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cell (IT-SOFC) cathode materials La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-delta (LSC) and La2NiO4+delta (LNO) were investigated by transmission electron microscopy (TEM) with energy dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDXS), electron energy loss spectroscopy (EELS), convergent beam electron diffraction (CBED), as well as by atomic force microscopy (AFM).
Titulo: Phase decomposition in the chromium- and silicon-poisoned IT-SOFC cathode materials La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ and La2NiO4 + δ

Sentencas: Analytical TEM revealed phase decomposition of the original, oxygen exchange-active materials LSC and LNO, and the formation of secondary phases after 3500 h of testing at 700 degrees C.
Titulo: Phase decomposition in the chromium- and silicon-poisoned IT-SOFC cathode materials La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ and La2NiO4 + δ

Sentencas: In the case of LSC, the phases SrCrO4, Co3O4, and CoCr2-xCoxO4 as well as a La-chromate phase with unknown stoichiometry were found in the near-surface region and at the grain boundaries.
Titulo: Phase decomposition in the chromium- and silicon-poisoned IT-SOFC cathode materials La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ and La2NiO4 + δ

Sentencas: Transport of cations, especially Sr and Cr, along the grain boundaries seems to play a key role in the degradation of LSC.
Titulo: Phase decomposition in the chromium- and silicon-poisoned IT-SOFC cathode materials La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ and La2NiO4 + δ

Sentencas: AFM was used to determine the three-dimensional shape including interplanar facet angles of SrCrO4 crystallites.
Titulo: Phase decomposition in the chromium- and silicon-poisoned IT-SOFC cathode materials La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ and La2NiO4 + δ

Sentencas: In the case of the Sr-free material LNO, the formation of La-silicate and La-Ni-chromate phases was observed, which seems to proceed from the surface toward the bulk.
Titulo: Phase decomposition in the chromium- and silicon-poisoned IT-SOFC cathode materials La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ and La2NiO4 + δ

Sentencas: Based on the experimental results, tentative mechanisms for the degradation processes are suggested.
Titulo: Phase decomposition in the chromium- and silicon-poisoned IT-SOFC cathode materials La0.6Sr0.4CoO3-δ and La2NiO4 + δ
